intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subsp. ranunculoides, commonly known as the common centaury, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. It is native to Europe and western Asia and is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and flower clusters.
